dcterms:creator: J. Jeong
J.-H. Cho
K.-H. Shim
B.-H. Kwon
B.-H. Lee
D.-Y. Lee
D.-H. Lee
S.-W. Lee
dcterms:description: The GigaScience dataset involves EEG files collected from 25 healthy subjects over multiple recording sessions, specifically designed to capture a wide range of intuitive upper-extremity movement tasks. Each subject participated in three distinct recording sessions, which were conducted on different days, typically with a one-week interval between sessions. This setup aims to account for inter-session variability and to ensure the reliability and consistency of the data across time. The dataset encompasses a total of 82,500 trials, averaging approximately 3,300 trials per subject, recorded using a 60-channel setup according to the international 10-20 system.
dcterms:title: GigaScience

dcterms:creator: C. Brunner
R. Leeb
G. R. Müller-Putz
A. Schlögl
G. Pfurtscheller
dcterms:description: The BCI Competition 2008 – Graz data set A (or Dataset 2a) focuses on EEG data from 9 subjects participating in a cue-based BCI paradigm involving four different motor imagery tasks. The dataset is structured into two sessions recorded on different days for each subject, with each session comprising 6 runs separated by short breaks. The dataset includes a total of 5184 trials.
dcterms:title: BCI Competition IV Dataset 2a

dcterms:creator: K. Venkatachalam
A. Devipriya
J. Maniraj
M. Sivaram
A. Ambikapathy
I. S. Amiri
dcterms:description: The BCI Competition III Dataset focuses on EEG data for motor imagery classification. The dataset is utilized to develop and test novel methods for classifying motor imagery tasks using EEG signals.
dcterms:title: BCI Competition III Dataset

dcterms:creator: F. Mattioli
C. Porcaro
G. Baldassarre
dcterms:description: The EEG Motor Movement/Imagery Dataset includes EEG data for high accuracy classification and transfer learning in motor imagery tasks. The dataset is designed to facilitate research in brain-computer interfaces.
dcterms:title: EEG Motor Movement/Imagery Dataset
